attributes.action: Adjust the level of medium level prizes from National Savings' Premium Bonds, so that there are more £500 and £1000 prizes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
£5K £10K £25K £50K £100K and £1M are the 'higher value prizes'; £500 and £1000 are 'medium value prizes'; and £50 and £100 are 'lower value prizes', per prospectus 2006/01.  
Presently, the distribution is 10/10/80 respectively by value.  

March 07: - Higher Value: 10% of the Prize Fund: - 
 £1M        2  
 £100K     16  
 £50K      34  
 £25K      65  
 £10K     164  
 £5K      329  
Medium Value; 10%: -
£1K     4,082  
£500   12,246  
Low Value; 80%: -
£100  232,487  
£50 1,168,411  
Tot. est. value: 
   £102.1 million with
1,417,836 prizes.
  The million is in our dreams - but only 30/year get them.
Abolishing the £25K prize, transferring the approximately £1.6 million into 'medium value prizes' would yield about 650 extra £1000 prizes, and about 1920 extra £500 prizes.
Split then: about 8.8%/11.2%/80.0%.
Getting rid of the £100K prize would have a similar effect.
These two moves, together, would therefore increase the winners of 'good money' by thirty percent, whilst reducing the higher level prizes by just 80 winners per month, with a split of 7.5/12.5/80.
PM - you know it makes sense!

rejection.details: Outside the remit or powers of the Prime Minister and Government.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
